Welcome to DANE-utils’s documentation!¶

class DANE_utils.jobspec.jobspec(source_url, source_id, source_set, tasks, job_id=None, metadata={}, priority=1, response={}, api=None)¶

This is a class representation of a job in DANE, it holds both data and logic.

Parameters

  • source_url (str) – URL pointing to source material for this block

  • source_id (str) – Id of the source object within the source collection

  • source_set (str) – Identifier specifying the source collection the material is from.

  • tasks – A specification of the tasks to be performed

  • job_id (int, optional) – ID of the job, assigned by DANE-core

  • metadata (dict, optional) – Dictionary containing metadata related to the job, or the source material

  • priority (int, optional) – Priority of the job in the task queue, defaults to 1

  • response (dict, optional) – Dictionary containing results from other tasks

  • api (base_classes.base_handler, optional) – Reference to a class:base_classes.base_handler which is used to communicate with the database, and queueing system.

static from_json(json_str)¶

Constructs a jobspec.jobspec instance from a JSON string

Parameters

json_str (str) – Serialised jobspec.jobspec

Returns

JSON string of the job

Return type

jobspec.jobspec

isDone()¶

Check if all tasks have completed.

refresh()¶

Retrieves the latest information for any fields that might have changed their values since the creation of this job. Requires an API to be set.

register()¶

Register this job with DANE-core, this will assign a job_id to the job, and a task_id to all tasks. Requires an API to be set.

retry()¶

Try to run the tasks in this job again. Unlike jobspec.jobspec.run() this will attempt to run tasks which encountered an error state.

run()¶

Run the tasks in this job.

set_api(api)¶

Set the API for the job and all subtasks

Parameters

api (base_classes.base_handler, optional) – Reference to a base_classes.base_handler which is used to communicate with the database, and queueing system.

to_json()¶

Returns this job serialised as JSON

Returns

JSON string of the job

Return type

str

DANE_utils.jobspec.parse(task_str)¶

Tries to parse a serialised jobspec.Task or jobspec.taskContainer, returning the correct object.

If input is a string, it tries to parse it as json if its still a string after this, then its a task str, so parse it as a Task. Otherwise we expect it to be a length 1 dict, with format: { CLASSNAME : { params } } or { CLASSNAME : [ sub_tasks ] }. In this case the class is expected to be a taskContainer subclass and the classname should start with ‘task’ (lowercase)

Parameters

task_str (dict) – Serialised jobspec.Task or jobspec.taskContainer

Returns

Instance of jobspec.Task or jobspec.taskContainer

Return type

jobspec.Task or jobspec.taskContainer

class DANE_utils.jobspec.taskContainer(name='taskContainer', api=None)¶

Returns the subclass, to allow usage as a class decorator.
